Dear Ms. Melendrez:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616-552-3662.

Sincerely,
Nabiha Rizk, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for
the continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 7/2/23, three youth went AWOL while with staff. Staff tried to
get them back on property, but all refused so staff had to contact
police. While they were AWOL Youth A asked Youth B and C to
touch Youth A’s penis. Youth C touched it and later cried about it.
Youth A also showed penis to youth B and C. This occurred near
a tree on the group home property. Youth A has been doing this
since youth A started living at the facility.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
07/06/2023.
I interviewed Chief Administrator on 07/07/2023. CA confirmed
that Youth A, B, and C AWOLed on 07/02/2023. She reported
there was four staff and six youths. She said Youth B and C were
threatening to AWOL and staff attempted to redirect but were not
successful. The three Youths AWOLed, Staff 1 followed them, and
the police were contacted. All three youths were found in the area
behind the facility. She said they were in the process of
completing the paperwork for Youth A to go back to the Ohio
facility. Youth A’S paperwork was approved on 07/05/2023 and he
was transferred to the Ohio facility. CA said there was one prior
incident involving Youth A and another youth that was investigated
under SI 2023C0000538.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 07/07/2023. Youth B is 13
years old and has been at the facility for 18 months. She reported
she and Youth C were planning on AWOLing on 07/02/2023, and
Youth A followed them. She said there were four staff supervising
and Staff 1 followed them when they ran out of the facility. Staff 1
tried to convince them not to AWOL, but they ran behind the
house and to the woodsy area behind the house. Youth B said
they were standing behind a large tree and Youth A pulled his
pants and made her and Youth C touch his penis. She said it was
very fast because they heard Staff and the police coming towards
them. Youth B said this was the only time something like this
2

happened with Youth A. She said Youth A has been moved to
another facility.
I interviewed Youth C at the facility on 07/07/2023. Youth C is 13
years old and has been at the facility for one year. She said on
07/02/2023 she and Youth B had been talking about wanting to
AWOL all day. She and Youth B ran out and went into the woods
behind the house. Youth A followed them. Youth B said there
were four staff supervising. Staff 1 followed them, but they ran
away from him. She said when they lost sight of Staff 1 Youth A
asked them to touch his penis. Youth A pulled his pants down and
made her and Youth B touch him. She said they heard Staff 1, so
they started to run again and hid in the tall grass. The police came
and found them hiding. Youth C denied any previous incidents
involving Youth A.
I interviewed Youth A at the Ohio facility on 07/07/2023. Youth A
is 15 years old and has been at the current location for two days.
Youth A admitted that he AWOLed with Youth B and C on
07/02/2023. He said there were four staff supervising. Staff 1
followed them, but he and Youth B and C ran to the area behind
the house and hid behind the tall grass. He denied asking Youth B
and C to touch his penis. Youth A said they hid in the tall grass
until the police found them. He again denied Youth B and C
touched his private area.
I interviewed Complainant/Therapist on 07/20/23 via telephone.
She reported Youth B disclosed during group therapy that when
she and Youth C AWOLed Youth A made them touch his penis.
I interviewed Youth A’s Foster Care Worker 1 on 07/20/23. She
reported Youth A was transferred back to the facility in Ohio. She
expressed no concerns regarding supervision.
I interviewed Staff 1 on 07/21/2023 via telephone. Staff 1 has
been working at the facility for 2 months and has completed all
training. He was working 2nd shift on 07/02/2023. There were three
other staff working on 07/02/2023. He reported on the day in
question Youth B and C were agitated and had been talking about
wanting to leave and Youth A knew he was going to be moved to
the Ohio facility. He said the three youths ran out of the back door
and went into the woodsy area behind the house. He followed
them, but lost sight after a few minutes. He continued to look for
them while waiting for the police. He said they were out of sight for
approximately 10 minutes.
I interviewed Staff 2 on 07/26/2023 via telephone. She reported on
07/02/2023 there were four staff and 6 youths. She was dealing
3

with another youth when Youth A, B, and C AWOLed. She said
Staff 1 followed the three youths and the police were immediately
contacted. She said there were not prior sexual incidents involving
Youth A, B and C. When the Youths returned, they did not report
any concerns.
I interviewed Staff 3 on 08/10/2023 via telephone. Staff 3 is a
direct care worker and has been working at the facility for one
year. She confirmed she was working on 07/02/2023. She
reported Youth A, B and C left the facility and Staff 1 followed
them. The police were called and responded immediately. The
three youths were found in the area behind the facility. She said
there were three other staff on-site and there were six youths. She
said the youths did not report any concerns when they came back
to the facility.
Documents Reviewed:
• Policy for Staff Requirements and Supervision dated
11/10/21: a staffing ratio of one staff to two clients during
awake hours and two awake staff to ten clients during
overnight hours in Michigan treatment facilities.
• Incident Report dated 07/21/23 at 7:45 pm, written by Staff
3. Youth A, B, and C walked off the property. Police were
notified, Staff 1 followed youths and with the assistance of
police located the three youths and returned to facility at 8
pm.
• Youth A’s initial service plan dated 05/24/23. The report
notes no concerns of sexualized behavior. Supervision-
while in the general areas of the home and bedroom staff
will provide visual supervision to ensure safety.
• Youth A’s Safety Plan dated 06/12/2023- Due to allegations
of inappropriate touching made by Youth A, he is to remain
10 feet away and must be closely monitored. This was
investigated under SI 2023C0000538.
4

Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule as there is insufficient
evidence that staff were not supervising or were aware of
inappropriate touching by Youth A. There was sufficient staff on
shift when the three youths AWOLed. The facility took appropriate
actions, called the police, and Youth A has been moved to another
facility.
CONSULTATION
Adrian Group Home accepts male and females ages 6 – 17 and
has one living space for ten youth. The mix of males and females
combined with the wide age range for one living space has
potential to be problematic. For supervision and programming
purposes, it is recommended they narrow the range and/or
consider only accepting males or females.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth C missed five therapy sessions in May and June.
Investigation I interviewed FCW 1 on 07/20/2023. FCW 1 reported Youth C
missed several therapy sessions in the month of May and June.
The youth go off site for therapy. The CA told her the reason
Youth C missed therapy was because she was on restrictions and
another time CA said they did not have staff to transport the Youth
to therapy. FCW expressed concerns about the staff not
answering the main number when attempting to contact the facility
and there is no answering machine or voicemail set up to leave
messages. FCW 1 also expressed concerns regarding incident
reporting, because staff will tell her that Youth C is on restrictions
for behavioral issues, but she is not notified of these incidents.
I interviewed Therapist on 07/20/2023 and Therapist confirmed
Youth C missed 5 therapy session in May and June. The reasons
provided to her for missed session were transportation issues,
lack of staff and disciplinary measures when youth was found to
have a vape pen.
5

Documents Reviewed:
• Facility Program Statement: Programming based on
individual strengths and needs is a primary focus. Services
include, as appropriate, recreational opportunities,
independent living skill development, employment,
volunteer service, music, art, horseback riding, activities of
daily living skills, and occupational therapy. Whatever will
benefit a client in care, according to the respective
Service/Treatment Plan, will be sought out and provided.
• Incident Report Policy: All critical incident reports must be
written, and notifications of incidents is required to the
placing agency, guardian, and administration staff as soon
as possible but within 24 hours.
• Youth B’s treatment plan dated 04/06/23 – 06/20/23: Youth
B is to participate in individual and group therapy as written
in her plan.
• Youth C’s treatment plan dated 03/08/2023- 05/24/2023:
Youth C is to participate in individual and group therapy as
written in her plan.
Analysis The facility is in violation of the rule. The facility did not follow their
program statement and ensure the youth is participating in therapy
according to her treatment plan. FCW and Therapist reported
Youth missed several therapy sessions in the month of May and
June.
Technical Assistances Provided:
• Staff should answer the facility telephone or have an
answering machine to ensure youths workers are able to
get a hold of staff.
• Staff should communicate and report non-critical incidents
to ensure Youths workers are aware all incidents involving
youths.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2023C0000500 intake 5/31/23; CAP pending.
2023C0000538 intake 6/13/23; CAP approved on 08/09/23
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and a corrective action plan is required. Per the
recommendation in special investigation 2023C0000500, a First Provisional license is
recommended.
